Job/Team Function: The Northern Ireland Human Rights Commission is an independent, statutory body set up in 1999. It was created by the Northern Ireland Act 1998, in compliance with a commitment made by the UK Government in the Belfast (Good Friday) Agreement of 10 April 1998. The Commission's role is to promote awareness of the importance of human rights in Northern Ireland, to review existing law and practice and to advise the Secretary of State for Northern Ireland, UK Government and the Executive of the Northern Ireland Assembly on what other measures ought to be taken to protect human rights in Northern Ireland
